alert.note: Alert for Grant; Kenton (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 20 at 4:25AM EDT until May 20 at 5:15AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 AM EDT FOR KENTON...CAMPBELL...NORTHEASTERN GRANT AND NORTHWESTERN PENDLETON COUNTIES... At 424 AM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Claryville, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. Locations impacted include... Covington, Florence, Independence, Erlanger, Edgewood, Alexandria, Elsmere, Highland Heights, Taylor Mill, Fort Wright, Crestview Hills, Claryville, Wilder, Dry Ridge, Silver Grove, Butler, Cold Spring, Ryland Heights, Crestview and Fairview. This includes I-75 in Kentucky between mile markers 159 and 161. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
